titles.title: To amend chapter 443 of title 49, United States Code, to extend the aviation war risk insurance program.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-2.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 3.

action.text: Mr. Shuster moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
Considered as unfinished business.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 407 - 1 (Roll no. 10).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 249 proposed by Senator Enzi for Senator Thompson.
Amendment SP 249 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Referred to the Committee on Commerce by unanimous consent.
Senate Committee on Commerce discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment and an amendment to the Title by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
House agreed to Senate amendments with an amendment pursuant to H. Res. 135.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate amendment.

bill.summary: 4/12/1999--House agreed to Senate amendment with amendment. Amends Federal aviation law to extend, through December 31, 2003, the aviation war risk insurance program.
